name: Ext.util.Cache
doc:
This class is used to manage simple, LRU caches. It provides an absolutely minimal container interface. It is created like this:

 this.itemCache = new Ext.util.Cache({
     miss: function (key) {
         return new CacheItem(key);
     }
 });

The miss abstract method must be implemented by either a derived class or at the instance level as shown above.

Once the cache exists and it can handle cache misses, the cache is used like so:

 var item = this.itemCache.get(key);

The key is some value that uniquely identifies the cached item.

In some cases, creating the cache item may require more than just the lookup key. In that case, any extra arguments passed to get will be passed to miss.

 this.otherCache = new Ext.util.Cache({
     miss: function (key, extra) {
         return new CacheItem(key, extra);
     }
 });

 var item = this.otherCache.get(key, extra);

To process items as they are removed, you can provide an evict method. The stock method is Ext.emptyFn and so does nothing.

For example:

 this.itemCache = new Ext.util.Cache({
     miss: function (key) {
         return new CacheItem(key);
     },

     evict: function (key, cacheItem) {
         cacheItem.destroy();
     }
 });

members.name: maxSize
members.doc: The maximum size the cache is allowed to grow to before further additions cause removal of the least recently used entry.
members.short_doc:
The maximum size the cache is allowed to grow to before
further additions cause removal of the least recently used en...

members.name: count
members.doc: The number of items in this cache.
members.short_doc: The number of items in this cache. ...

members.name: clear
members.short_doc: Removes all items from this cache. ...

members.name: each
members.doc: Calls the given function fn for each item in the cache. The items will be passed to fn from most-to-least recently used.

params.name: fn
params.doc: The function to call for each cache item.

properties.name: value
properties.doc: The value in the cache for the item.

members.short_doc: Calls the given function fn for each item in the cache. ...

members.name: evict
members.doc: This method is called internally from get when the cache is full and the least-recently-used (LRU) item has been removed.

params.name: key
params.doc: The cache lookup key for the item being removed.

params.name: value
params.doc: The cache value (returned by miss) for the item being removed.

members.short_doc:
This method is called internally from get when the cache is full and
the least-recently-used (LRU) item has been remo...

members.name: get
members.doc: Finds an item in this cache and returns its value. If the item is present, it is shuffled into the MRU (most-recently-used) position as necessary. If the item is missing, the miss method is called to create the item.

params.name: args
params.doc: Arguments for the miss method should it be needed.

members.short_doc: Finds an item in this cache and returns its value. ...

members.name: linkEntry
members.doc: Inserts the given entry at the front (MRU) end of the entry list.
members.short_doc: Inserts the given entry at the front (MRU) end of the entry list. ...

members.name: miss
members.doc: This method is called by get when the key is not found in the cache. The implementation of this method should create the (expensive) value and return it. Whatever arguments were passed to get will be passed on to this method.

params.name: key
params.doc: The cache lookup key for the item.

params.name: args
params.doc: Any other arguments originally passed to get.

members.short_doc: This method is called by get when the key is not found in the cache. ...

members.name: unlinkEntry
members.doc: Removes the given entry from the entry list.

params.name: evicted
params.doc: Pass true if evict should be called.

members.short_doc: Removes the given entry from the entry list. ...

short_doc: This class is used to manage simple, LRU caches. ...
